intro: Amsinckia nephrocarpa, commonly known as the kidneyleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, basal leaves that are kidney-shaped, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Amsinckia nephrocarpa is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its drought tolerance and ability to reseed itself.
